subject: Re: QS WEB New Testament
msgSnippet: Most certainly. Besides, the stage of using Adapt-it is mostly finished anyway. No tool can replace good-old editing by hand.
messageBody:
Most certainly. Besides, the stage of using Adapt-it is mostly finished anyway. No tool can replace good-old editing by hand.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Nathan Sharfi <bonusfrogs@...> wrote:
>
> On May 24, 2013, at 7:18 PM, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@...> wrote:
>
> > Years of work have paid off. The QS drafts of all the books in the New Testament are up in the code section of the web-qs project on Sourceforge. Are they perfect? Not at all. Can we work together to make them ready for widespread distribution? You bet.
>
> Assuming common vocabulary (I don't expect "R'lyeh" in the NT), will Call of Cthulhu and Civil Disobedience fixes get backported to your AdaptIt files in a way that'll help improve the New Testament project?
>
